author: Dow Jones newswires
title: Greece to fire top tax official
text:
Greece's top tax collection official Ekaterini Savvaidou will be removed from her position the cabinet has decided, according to senior government officials.
The government's decision to remove Mrs Savvaidou from her position could be a further blow to the country's tax collection efforts.
Mrs Savvaidou is the General Secretary for the Public Revenues Authority. She also helps the government in its negotiations with the country's international creditors, who are now in Athens, having started a fresh round of consultation with government officials on Wednesday.
Last week, Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras demanded Mrs Savvaidou's resignation, after she was charged with a breach of duty by a prosecutor for attempting to defer tax collections from the country's TV stations by a year, in violation of a law.
But Mrs Savvaidou, who was appointed in mid-2014 by the previous conservative government, denied any wrongdoing and has refused to quit.
Mrs Savvaidou is also under fire for a decision to review a fine of â‚¬78 million ($US88.5 million) imposed on an IT firm.
In a long written statement published Tuesday, Mrs Savvaidou stressed that she wouldn't resign at a time that her "honesty, dignity and proper completion of my duties are being put in doubt due to the implication of my name in a judicial process."
She added that her resignation could be regarded as admitting her involvement in a scandal or lead to "the transformation of the independent General Secretariat for Public Revenue into a frightened tax administration that cannot carry out its duties."
